total_revenue.context: Q3 2025 revenue of $51.24B driven by AI-powered ads, creator content, and Reality Labs momentum.

costs_and_expenses.context: Expenses rose on legal-related costs, accelerated compensation, and infrastructure/depreciation growth.

operating_income.context: Operating margin moderated as investments in AI infrastructure and talent offset continued ad momentum.

net_income.context: Includes $15.93B non-recurring tax charge tied to the One Big Beautiful Bill Act; excluding the charge, net income would have been $18.64B.

eps.context: Diluted EPS reflects the deferred tax asset valuation charge; adjusted EPS would have been $7.25.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operational cash flow remained strong at $30.0B despite the tax provisioning.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow after $19.4B CapEx and record non-marketable equity investments.

capital_expenditures.context: CapEx surge to $70-72B FY guide as Meta builds Prometheus, Hyperion, and Titan clusters plus expanded data centers.

share_repurchases.context: Continued buybacks under the $50B program, offsetting SBC dilution.

other_revenue.context: WhatsApp paid messaging and Meta Verified subscriptions grew 59%.

revenue.context: AI glasses and new Quest stocking ahead of holidays drove large year-over-year upside.

expenses.context: Technology and manufacturing investments kept the RL loss near $4.5B.

initiatives: Unified Lattice architecture expansion across ranking and inference
Andromeda/ GEMS enhancements for longer context and higher conversions
Advantage+ streamlined campaign flow plus global incremental attribution & omnichannel rollout
goals: Drive further ad conversion lifts with unified models
Enable small advertisers with generative creative and automation

milestones: Meta Superintelligence Labs scaling frontier models with compute to match
Meta AI surpassing 1B MAUs with deeper content discovery and Vibes adoption
AI glasses translation/dubbing and new high-resolution display hardware
goals: Use Meta AI to power business messaging agents and new content formats
Expand AI wearables and compute-backed device roadmap

infrastructure.description: 2025 CapEx now $70-72B and 2026 expects even higher growth as compute needs continue to scale for AI research and core ranking.
drivers: data center financing partnerships for optionality

q4_2025_revenue_guidance.context: Assumes ~1% FX tailwind, with moderating Reality Labs revenue after Q3 stocking.

full_year_2025_expenses.context: 22-24% YoY growth as infrastructure, comp, and regulatory/legal headwinds continue.

capex.context: Up ~$30B YoY; planning to keep rising in 2026 with additional infrastructure and cloud spend.

tax_rate.context: Q3 includes a one-time noncash charge but future cash tax payments should fall under the new U.S. law.

regulatory.focus: DMA/LPA, EU/US legal matters, and youth trials may impact revenue; engaging with EU Commission on less personalized offerings.
